content.2: And I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
content.3: Unto a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou
content.4: And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and no man did put on him his ornaments.
content.6: And the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments by the mount Horeb.
content.7: And Moses took the tabernacle, and pitched it without the camp, afar off from the camp, and called it the Tabernacle of the congregation. And it came to pass,
content.8: And it came to pass, when Moses went out unto the tabernacle,
content.9: And it came to pass, as Moses entered into the tabernacle, the cloudy pillar descended, and stood
content.10: And all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand
content.13: Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thy sight, shew me now thy way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in thy sight: and consider that this nation
content.14: And he said, My presence shall go
content.15: And he said unto him, If thy presence go not
content.16: For wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight?
content.18: And he said, I beseech thee, shew me thy glory.
content.19: And he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and I will proclaim the name of the
content.20: And he said, Thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man see me, and live.
content.22: And it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a clift of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:
content.23: And I will take away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
